definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: He fled to Thailand following Burma's pro-democracy uprising in 1988.
sentences.chinese: 在1988年的緬甸民運起義動亂後逃到泰國。

sentences.english: A weak and fatigue government will bring along more social unrests.
sentences.chinese: 一個疲軟的政府，就會帶來更大更強的動亂。

sentences.english: But he didn't feel safe there amid the political turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 但是處於政治動亂中的他根本沒有安全感。

sentences.english: The military and civil authorities are working together to put down the unrest.
sentences.chinese: 軍政和民政當局正聯手鎮壓動亂。

sentences.english: Each new day brings another plot to assassinate me and bring us closer to anarchy and terror.
sentences.chinese: 日日有人謀劃暗殺我，將國家逼向動亂和恐怖。

sentences.english: They were reimprisoned for causing a disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 他們因製造動亂而再次入獄。

sentences.english: Ano ther aspect of the international situation is the upheaval in some socialist countries.
sentences.chinese: 國際局勢還有一個方面，就是社會主義國家動亂。

sentences.english: There is good reason to believe that Lilley was the case officer running the destabilization operation.
sentences.chinese: 如果要說李潔明是動亂的承辦人，理由是很充分的。

sentences.english: The late 1980s were an unsettling period for China.
sentences.chinese: 中國的20世紀80年代末是一個動亂不安的時期。

sentences.english: Its this unwillingness to pump money into North Korea that is causing instability.
sentences.chinese: 擔心引發動亂纔不願讓資金流入朝鮮。

sentences.english: The warden's authority diminished after the revolt.
sentences.chinese: 典獄長的權威在動亂後下降了。

sentences.english: The country heightened security in anticipation of unrest leading up to Sunday's protests.
sentences.chinese: 提高該國在安全的動亂導致預期至週日的抗議活動。

sentences.english: Ten centuries before that Wanderlust would have led to another outbreak of anarchy.
sentences.chinese: 十個世紀以前一個漫遊者引發了另一場政治動亂。

sentences.english: Oftens the companies are training armies in turbulent areas.
sentences.chinese: 這類公司經常是到動亂地區訓練部隊。

sentences.english: In the years leading up to the great Burmese political crisis of 1988, however, China cut back its support to the BCP.
sentences.chinese: 年緬甸發生政治動亂後，中國終止了對緬共的支持。

sentences.english: So there's quite a lot of unrests here.

definition: variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
